name: Public Construction
description: Assessment of involvement in government construction, infrastructure, and public services contracts. Includes public buildings, infrastructure projects, and public utility services.
field: government infrastructure, public services, public construction

Q1.text: Is the client, through their activity, linked to contracts for government construction or infrastructure, including the purchase of goods, services, or works by a government agency?
Q1.summary: Government Involvement Verification - Is the client connected to government construction/infrastructure contracts?

Q2.text: Does the client's government construction activity involve connections to State-Named Entities (SNE) or high-risk jurisdictions for corruption?
Q2.summary: SCAP Check - State connection and corruption risk assessment

Q3.text: Is the client activity solely financed by a private company (no government funding)?

Q4.text: Is the client activity solely done for regional or local levels of government (i.e., not for federal, central, or national government entities)?

Q5.text: Is the client involved in the construction of public buildings (administrative offices, national court buildings, military bases), public infrastructure (roads, railways, bridges, tunnels, airports), or providing public services (water supply, sewage treatment, electrical grids, waste management)?
Q5.summary: Public Construction Verification - Type of public service or construction

Q6.text: Does the client have direct engagement with the government construction operations (primary contractor, project manager, or direct service provider to government)?
Q6.summary: Direct Engagement - Direct operational involvement in government projects

Q7.text: Does the client hold an executive management or board of directors position in the construction/infrastructure business?
Q7.summary: Substantial Connection - Executive or board position

Q8.text: Does the income from the government construction/infrastructure activity represent more than 10% of the client's total income?
Q8.summary: Substantial Connection - Income threshold for direct engagement (>10%)

Q9.text: Does the client have indirect involvement with government construction (subcontractor, equipment supplier, consultant, or investor in public construction companies)?
Q9.summary: Indirect Engagement - Supporting roles in government projects

Q10.text: Does the income from the government construction/infrastructure activity represent more than 25% of the client's total income?
Q10.summary: Substantial Connection - Income threshold for indirect engagement (>25%)

Q1_NO.reason: Client is not linked to government construction or infrastructure contracts

Q3_YES.reason: Activity solely financed by private company - not considered SIAP

Q4_YES.reason: Activity solely for regional/local government (not federal/central/national) - not considered SIAP

Q5_NO.reason: Client not involved in public buildings, public infrastructure, or public services

Q7_YES.reason: Direct government construction engagement with executive/board position requires Enhanced Due Diligence

Q8_YES.reason: Direct government construction engagement with income >10% requires Enhanced Due Diligence

Q8_NO.reason: Direct government construction engagement but income <=10% - SIAP without Enhanced Due Diligence

Q9_NO.reason: No direct or indirect government construction engagement identified

Q10_YES.reason: Indirect government construction engagement with income >25% requires Enhanced Due Diligence

Q10_NO.reason: Indirect government construction engagement but income <=25% - SIAP without Enhanced Due Diligence
